chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kavon Lynch-Whitley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kavon Lynch-Whitley in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Kavon Lynch-Whitley.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Discussion place on record. Defense provided update regarding Deferred Prosecution Agreement negotiations. Defense requested an adjournment. State did not object. Court addressed good JusticePoint Report and encouraged the defendant to continue the good work. Court ordered case adjourned for DPA Plea hearing, Branch 2.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 12, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Kavon Lynch-Whitley in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Kavon Lynch-Whitley.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin. 

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court addresses Justice Point discharge.  Court REINSTATES Justice Point level 3 and orders the defendant to contact Justice Point right after court hearing.  Court advises defendant that supervision with Justice Point is required and necessary.  Court rescheduled plea and sentencing date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kavon Lynch-Whitley in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD BY ZOOM. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kavon Lynch-Whitley in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom and off the record. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 2, 2022 - received

Defendant Kavon Lynch-Whitley in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Sida.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Ramiro C.; Mayra A.C.-M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Kavon Lynch-Whitley in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Kavon Lynch-Whitley in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kavon Lynch-Whitley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Due to assignment of Assistant District Attorney, the defendant is advised that case is reassigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
